name: Jubair Ahmed Nabin
title: Lecturer in Computer Science | Research in Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, and Federated AI | Aspiring PhD Candidate
institution: International University of Business Agriculture and Technology
bio: I am a Lecturer in the Department of Computer Science with research interests in machine learning, cybersecurity, and intelligent data-driven systems. My work applies deep learning models such as CNNs, LSTMs, and transformers to real-world security and anomaly detection problems, including federated learning, network intrusion detection, and video anomaly analysis. I have published in IEEE conferences and continue to explore the integration of federated AI and cybersecurity to develop secure and trustworthy systems. I am currently seeking PhD opportunities in Computer Science to advance research in secure and responsible artificial intelligence.

researchInterests.description: I develop secure and resilient systems focused on protecting digital infrastructures, with emphasis on modern network-based threats and defense mechanisms.

I design ML- and DL-based intrusion detection models, study adversarial machine learning to strengthen IDS against evasion attacks, and apply explainable AI (XAI) to improve transparency and trust in detection decisions.
I explore generative modeling for cyber defense, including synthetic data creation, attack simulation, and adversarial scenario generation to enhance training and evaluation of security systems.
I develop and optimize learning algorithms and neural architectures to solve complex data-driven challenges across security and related domains.

I investigate privacy-preserving distributed learning approaches that enable collaborative model training across decentralized data sources, with applications in secure analytics, intrusion detection, and trustworthy AI.
